page.title: 05Employment
page.content: The majority of people in Loughton are {commuters}to London, and therefore professional white-collar workers. The people employed in the Loughton area tend to have part time jobs. There are a large number of self-employed people. There are 2,100{unemployed}people in Loughton, 1,900 of which are men. The {job centre}has 160 jobs and only about 40 people get a job per week. Most jobs on offer are part-time and the pay is between Â£1.80 and Â£2.00 per hour. School leavers and the 50+ age group find it hardest to find jobs. The most popular{jobs}people go for are working in shops,cleaning,catering and office work. If you go on the dole you can get Â£28.45 per week if you're single and Â£46.00 for married couples.
